text: [Music]
in downtown Manhattan New York City once
again memorializes the events of
September 11th 2001 with a pair of
brilliant white beams called Tribute in
Light Tribute in Light is the work of
several teams of architects and
designers the display is organized by
the Municipal Art Society tribute and
light was first illuminated on March
11th 2002 six months after the attack
and again on September 11th 2003 it has
shown on every September 11th since
funding for Tribute in Light has been
guaranteed through 2008 with discussions
underway to produce them again in 2009
the beams consist of 88 space cannons
searchlights organized in two 50 by 50
foot squares that sit atop the battery
garage six blocks south of Ground Zero
and so for one more year at least the
too familiar beams pierced the heavens
and serve as a silent reminder of lost
lives and the two blooming towers that
were once a signature of the Manhattan
skyline
[Music]
